009package com.weather.sdk.cache;
010
011import com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData;
012import java.util.Optional;
013
014/**
015 * Interface contract for weather data caching with LRU eviction and TTL (Time-To-Live) support.
016 *
017 * <p>This interface defines the contract for caching weather data with intelligent eviction
018 * policies and automatic expiration to ensure data freshness while optimizing API usage.
019 *
020 * <h2>Core Features</h2>
021 *
022 * <ul>
023 *   <li><strong>LRU Eviction</strong>: When cache reaches maximum size, automatically evicts the
024 *       least recently used entry
025 *   <li><strong>TTL Support</strong>: Each cache entry has a configurable time-to-live and
026 *       automatically expires after the TTL duration
027 *   <li><strong>Thread Safety</strong>: All operations are thread-safe and can be called
028 *       concurrently by multiple threads
029 *   <li><strong>Cache Key Normalization</strong>: City names are normalized to lowercase, trimmed
030 *       format for consistent lookup
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <h2>LRU Eviction Policy</h2>
034 *
035 * <p>The cache implements a Least Recently Used (LRU) eviction strategy:
036 *
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>When the cache reaches its maximum size, the least recently accessed entry is removed
039 *   <li>Access order is updated by both {@code get()} and {@code put()} operations
040 *   <li>Eviction happens automatically during {@code put()} operations when the cache is full
041 *   <li>The eviction is atomic and thread-safe
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h2>TTL (Time-To-Live) Behavior</h2>
045 *
046 * <p>Each cached entry includes a timestamp indicating when it was cached:
047 *
048 * <ul>
049 *   <li>When retrieving data via {@code get()}, the cache checks if the entry is stale
050 *   <li>An entry is stale if: current_time - cached_time > TTL duration
051 *   <li>Stale entries return {@link Optional#empty()} and are automatically removed
052 *   <li>Default TTL: 10 minutes (configurable via {@link com.weather.sdk.config.SDKConfiguration})
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <h2>Cache Key Normalization</h2>
056 *
057 * <p>Cache keys are automatically normalized to ensure consistent lookup:
058 *
059 * <ul>
060 *   <li>City names are converted to lowercase
061 *   <li>Leading and trailing whitespace is trimmed
062 *   <li>Example: "New York" → "new york"
063 *   <li>This ensures "New York" and "new york" map to the same cache entry
064 * </ul>
065 *
066 * <h2>Thread Safety Guarantees</h2>
067 *
068 * <p>This interface and its implementations are designed to be thread-safe:
069 *
070 * <ul>
071 *   <li>Multiple threads can call methods concurrently without external synchronization
072 *   <li>All operations (get, put, evict, clear) are atomic
073 *   <li>LRU ordering is maintained correctly in multi-threaded environments
074 *   <li>TTL expiration is checked safely during concurrent access
075 * </ul>
076 *
077 * <h2>Usage Example</h2>
078 *
079 * <pre>
080 * // Example usage with different cache operations
081 * WeatherCache cache = new DefaultWeatherCache(Duration.ofMinutes(10), 100);
082 *
083 * // Store weather data
084 * WeatherData weatherData = createWeatherDataFor("London");
085 * cache.put("London", weatherData);
086 *
087 * // Retrieve weather data
088 * Optional{@code <WeatherData>} cached = cache.get("London");
089 * if (cached.isPresent()) {
090 *   System.out.println("Cached weather: " + cached.get());
091 * }
092 *
093 * // Remove specific entry
094 * cache.evict("London");
095 *
096 * // Check cache size
097 * int currentSize = cache.size();
098 *
099 * // Clear all entries
100 * cache.clear();
101 * </pre>
102 *
103 * @see WeatherData
104 * @since 1.0.0
105 */
106public interface WeatherCache {
107
108  /**
109   * Retrieves weather data for the specified city from the cache.
110   *
111   * <p>This method performs the following operations atomically:
112   *
113   * <ol>
114   *   <li>Normalizes the city name (lowercase, trimmed)
115   *   <li>Checks if the entry exists and is not expired (TTL check)
116   *   <li>If expired or not found, returns {@link Optional#empty()}
117   *   <li>If valid, updates the access order (LRU) and returns the data
118   * </ol>
119   *
120   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently.
121   *
122   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
123   * @return an {@link Optional} containing the cached weather data if found and valid, or {@link
124   *     Optional#empty()} if not found or expired
125   */
126  Optional<WeatherData> get(String cityName);
127
128  /**
129   * Stores weather data for the specified city in the cache.
130   *
131   * <p>This method performs the following operations atomically:
132   *
133   * <ol>
134   *   <li>Normalizes the city name (lowercase, trimmed)
135   *   <li>Records the current timestamp for TTL calculation
136   *   <li>If cache is full, evicts the least recently used entry
137   *   <li>Stores the new entry with the current timestamp
138   *   <li>Updates the access order (LRU)
139   * </ol>
140   *
141   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently.
142   *
143   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
144   * @param weatherData the weather data to cache (must not be null)
145   */
146  void put(String cityName, WeatherData weatherData);
147
148  /**
149   * Evicts (removes) the weather data entry for the specified city from the cache.
150   *
151   * <p>This method performs the following operations atomically:
152   *
153   * <ol>
154   *   <li>Normalizes the city name (lowercase, trimmed)
155   *   <li>Removes the entry if it exists
156   *   <li>If the entry doesn't exist, this operation has no effect
157   * </ol>
158   *
159   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently.
160   *
161   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
162   */
163  void evict(String cityName);
164
165  /**
166   * Clears all entries from the cache.
167   *
168   * <p>This method removes all cached weather data and resets the cache to its initial state. After
169   * this operation, {@link #size()} will return 0.
170   *
171   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
172   */
173  void clear();
174
175  /**
176   * Returns the current number of entries in the cache.
177   *
178   * <p>This includes both valid (non-expired) and expired entries that haven't been cleaned up yet.
179   * Expired entries are automatically removed during {@code get()} operations.
180   *
181   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
182   *
183   * @return the current number of entries in the cache
184   */
185  int size();
186
187  /**
188   * Returns a set of all cached city names.
189   *
190   * <p>This method provides access to all city names currently in the cache, which is useful for
191   * operations like polling all cached cities.
192   *
193   * <p>Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe and returns an unmodifiable set to prevent
194   * external modification of the cache's internal state.
195   *
196   * @return a set of all cached city names (normalized to lowercase)
197   */
198  java.util.Set<String> getAllCachedCities();
199}
